bugs.title: CVE-2024-1062 389-ds-base: a heap overflow leading to denail-of-servce while writing a value larger than 256 chars (in log_entry_attr)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-1062 389-ds-base: a heap overflow leading to denail-of-servce while writing a value larger than 256 chars (in log_entry_attr)

long_desc.thetext:
A heap overflow problem was found in RHDS leading to denail-of-servce while writing a value larger than 256 chars (in log_entry_attr)

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2256711

bugs.title: CVE-2024-2199 389-ds-base: Malformed userPassword may cause crash at do_modify in slapd/modify.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-2199 389-ds-base: Malformed userPassword may cause crash at do_modify in slapd/modify.c

long_desc.thetext:
A denial of service vulnerability was found in 389-ds-base ldap server. An authenticated user may cause a server crash while modifying `userPassword` using malformed input.

References:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2266067

Created 389-ds-base tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283632]

bugs.title: CVE-2024-3657 389-ds-base: potential denial of service via specially crafted kerberos AS-REQ request

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-3657 389-ds-base: potential denial of service via specially crafted kerberos AS-REQ request

long_desc.thetext:
Details:
We received a report that a specially-crafted Kerberos AS-REQ packet can potentially cause a denial of service. Per the reporter: "A specially crafted Kerberos AS-REQ request may cause a failure on the directory server. 

Tested FreeIPA version:
ipa-server-4.10.3

Steps to reproduce (see attachments):
1. Make request: kinit $(cat poc.txt)
2. Check krb5kdc log and ipactl status. (Directory Service: Stopped)

Created 389-ds-base tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283631]

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

bugs.title: CVE-2024-5953 389-ds-base: Malformed userPassword hash may cause Denial of Service

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-5953 389-ds-base: Malformed userPassword hash may cause Denial of Service

long_desc.thetext:
A denial of service vulnerability was found in 389-ds-base ldap server. This issue may allow an authenticated user to cause a server crash or hang
while authenticating with an user having a malformed userPassword.
By default only the administrator may directly add hashed password that can trigger the issue. But if nsslapd-allow-hashed-passwords config parameter is turned on, any user can trigger the issue. 

The problem is triggered by adding a password to an user using the hashed format (with a hash value too long for the specified hash scheme)
Then later on when trying to authenticate on that user its triggers the buffer overflow

By default, only  administrators are allowed to add hashed passwords but there is a configuration parameter (nsslapd-allow-hashed-passwords) allowing any users to add hashed passwords and potentially trigger the DoS. 

This vulnerability affects versions: >= 1.3.7.2

Created 389-ds-base tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2292109]

Hi Patrick,

Can you create a clone of this ticket for a directory_server_12.4 z stream build.

Thank you

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2024:4633 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:4633

  Red Hat Directory Server 12.4 for RHEL 9

A denial of service vulnerability was found in 389-ds-base ldap server. This issue may allow an authenticated user to cause a server crash or hang
while authenticating with an user having a malformed userPassword.
By default only the administrator may directly add hashed password that can trigger the issue. But if nsslapd-allow-hashed-passwords config parameter is turned on, any user can trigger the issue. 

The problem is triggered by adding a password to an user using the hashed format (with a hash value too long for the specified hash scheme)
Then later on when trying to authenticate on that user its triggers the buffer overflow

By default, only  administrators are allowed to add hashed passwords but there is a configuration parameter (nsslapd-allow-hashed-passwords) allowing any users to add hashed passwords and potentially trigger the DoS. 

This vulnerability affects versions: >= 1.3.7.2

Created 389-ds-base tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2292109]

Hi Patrick,

Can you create a clone of this ticket for a directory_server_12.4 z stream build.

Thank you

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

# Description of your update
